parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. While the post doesn't explicitly name a specific candidate, it strongly encourages voting for independent candidates, implicitly contrasting them with established parties.  This could be interpreted as referring to a category of candidates (independents) participating in the election.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The hashtags further suggest an intention to reach a broad public, not just a select group of individuals.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The primary objective of the post is to encourage people to vote, specifically for independent candidates. The call to action ("Let's go out to vote and change the fate of Romania!") directly aims to influence electoral behavior. The phrasing "The war is between PARTIES and PEOPLE" clearly positions independent candidates as an alternative to established parties, furthering the electoral objective.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post presents an opinion, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic content. It's a clear advocacy piece promoting a specific viewpoint (voting for independent candidates) rather than providing balanced information.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. Although presented as a personal opinion, the context of a paid Facebook advertisement and the clear call to action to vote for independent candidates transforms it into something beyond a personal expression. The intent is clearly to influence the electoral outcome.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1977180832709415</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, a paid advertisement by Virgil Pirvulescu, promotes voting for independent candidates.  While it doesn't explicitly mention any specific candidate by name, the clear call to action and the framing of the political landscape as a "war between parties and people" strongly suggests an intention to influence the vote in favor of independent candidates. The post's broad reach via Facebook advertising and the use of relevant hashtags further supports this conclusion.  The timing of the post, close to election day, also increases the likelihood of influencing voter behavior.  The argument that it's simply a personal opinion is weakened by the fact that it's a paid advertisement, indicating a deliberate attempt to reach a large audience and sway their votes.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Independent Candidates</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Virgil Pirvulescu, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu mesajul  „Războiul este între PARTIDE și OAMENI. Partidele ne dezinformează, dar la noi este puterea! Duminică, 1 Decembrie, să ieșim la vot și să schimbăm soarta României!”, care are ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea candidaților independenți, prin îndemnul direct la vot și contrastarea lor cu partidele politice, fapt ce constituie propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei de campanie.  ID-ul postării pe Facebook este 1977180832709415.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
